name: msemen
steps: Mix the flour, semolina, salt, baking powder, and baker's yeast.
Gradually add the warm water and knead until you get a smooth and elastic dough.
Form small balls the size of a mandarin. Coat them with oil and let rest for 15 to 30 minutes.
Roll out each ball very thinly on an oiled work surface to form a transparent disk.
Brush the disk with melted butter, sprinkle with a little fine semolina, and fold it into a square.
Let the squares rest for 15 minutes.
Slightly flatten each square and cook in a hot skillet (without oil) on both sides until golden and flaky.
